headline: Follow it live: The landing of Nasa's Curiosity Mars rover
text: In the early hours of Monday morning, Nasa's Mars rover, Curiosity, will slam into the Martian atmosphere and attempt the most complex landing on an alien world since space exploration began. The $2.5bn mission will explore the huge Gale Crater to answer whether Mars was ever capable of providing a home to life as we know it, had it ever arisen on the planet.  Join us from 6am BST on Monday morning as we live blog the nail-biting descent, and the "seven minutes of terror", during which the spacecraft must fly through the Martian sky, deploy a parachute, fire retrorockets, and lower the car-sized rover on cables to the ground. Touchdown is due at 6.31am BST.
